18°C	(65°F)	is	
comfortable.
• If it is very warm, your 
baby may not need any 
bedclothes other than a 
sheet.
• Even in winter, most babies 
who are unwell or feverish 
do not need extra clothes.
• Babies should never sleep 
with a hot-water bottle or 
electric blanket, next to a 
radiator,	heater	or	fire,	or	in	
direct sunshine.
• Babies lose excess heat 
from their heads, so make 
sure their heads cannot 
be covered by bedclothes 
during sleep periods.
Don’t let your baby’s head
